item.title: Adaptive and Robust Data Poisoning Detection and Sanitization in Wearable IoT Systems using Large Language Models
item.description: arXiv:2511.02894v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: The widespread integration of wearable sensing devices in Internet of Things (IoT) ecosystems, particularly in healthcare, smart homes, and industrial applications, has required robust human activity recognition (HAR) techniques to improve functionali...<br><br><small><strong>Source:</strong> arXiv | <strong>Keywords:</strong> LLM, few-shot learning, step-by-step, arxiv, prompting | <strong>Relevance:</strong> 100%</small>
item.author: noreply@contextengineering.news (arXiv)

item.title: Zero-shot data citation function classification using transformer-based large language models (LLMs)
item.description: arXiv:2511.02936v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Efforts have increased in recent years to identify associations between specific datasets and the scientific literature that incorporates them. Knowing that a given publication cites a given dataset, the next logical step is to explore how or why that...<br><br><small><strong>Source:</strong> arXiv | <strong>Keywords:</strong> LLM, transformer, model, framework, arxiv | <strong>Relevance:</strong> 100%</small>
item.author: noreply@contextengineering.news (arXiv)

item.title: Context-Engineering - "Context engineering is the delicate art and science of filling the context window with just the right information for the next step." — Andrej Karpathy. A frontier, first-principles handbook inspired by Karpathy and 3Blue1Brown for moving beyond prompt engineering to the wider discipline of context design, orchestration, and optimization.
item.description: "Context engineering is the delicate art and science of filling the context window with just the right information for the next step." — Andrej Karpathy. A frontier, first-principles handbook inspired by Karpathy and 3Blue1Brown for moving beyond prompt engineering to the wider discipline of context design, orchestration, and optimization.<br><br><small><strong>Source:</strong> GitHub | <strong>Keywords:</strong> context window, prompt, prompt engineering, context | <strong>Relevance:</strong> 100%</small>

item.title: Reading Between the Lines: The One-Sided Conversation Problem
item.description: arXiv:2511.03056v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Conversational AI is constrained in many real-world settings where only one side of a dialogue can be recorded, such as telemedicine, call centers, and smart glasses. We formalize this as the one-sided conversation problem (1SC): inferring and learnin...<br><br><small><strong>Source:</strong> arXiv | <strong>Keywords:</strong> LLM, prompting, model, arxiv, study | <strong>Relevance:</strong> 80%</small>
